title: Virtual knot
summary: In knot theory, a virtual knot is a generalization of knots in 3-dimensional Euclidean space, R3, to knots in thickened surfaces Σ × [ 0 , 1 ] {\displaystyle \Sigma \times [0,1]} modulo an equivalence relation called stabilization/destabilization. Here Σ {\displaystyle \Sigma } is required to be closed and oriented. Virtual knots were first introduced by Kauffman (1999).
